intro: Anemia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican anemia plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and small, pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
